biogHist.abstract: Records of McBride Maternity Hospital is a small collection of records held by The Salvation Army Australia Southern Territory Territorial Archives and Museum in Melbourne. The collection dates from around 1893 to 1986 and includes photographs and social files relating to the Adelaide Maternity Home, McBride Maternity Hospital, and McBride Hospital.
biogHist.p: The Salvation Army Australia Southern Territory Territorial Archives and Museum, also known as the Heritage Centre, is open to the public. Some records may be restricted under privacy legislation or as a result of conditions placed by donors of material. Some material may be considered by the Archivist to be too frail for handling. The Archives does not hold personal client records or financial material. Please contact the Archives by phone or email for more information.

Records of McBride Maternity Hospital is a small collection of records held by The Salvation Army Southern Territorial Archives and Museum in Melbourne that includes photographs and general historical information of Adelaide Maternity Hospital, McBride Maternity Hospital and McBride Hospital.

list.item:
McBride Hospital (SAust) [Social Files], 1893?-1986?
These records includes a folder of general historical information.

McBride Maternity Hospital, South Australia [Photographs], 1920s-1930s & 1980
These records include various photographs of buildings, they sometimes include staff. The photographs are held in Boxes 18, 70, 72 and 77 (Salvation Army Archives Reference Number).
